Package co.cookies.sdk.storefront

Interface Storefront.ProfileClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.ProfileV1Client>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1
    Enclosing interface:
    Storefront
    public static interface Storefront.ProfileClient
extends ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.ProfileV1Client>
    Specifies the API surface for the Profile Service, a constituent part of the Cookies Storefront, which is responsible for managing user profile information, and exposing tools to edit or update such information in different circumstances.

    The Profile API works in tandem with Cookies Identity Services, available at `accounts.cookies.co`. After a user authenticates via OAuth or SAML, an access token is yielded which allows them access to view other user profiles (where allowed via privacy settings) and view and edit their own user profile, all via this service.

      Asynchronously fetch the specified user profile, specified either via their username or their user ID; if the user could not be found, or the invoking user does not have access and the requested user's profile is set to private, return Optional.empty().

    • Method Detail

      • usernameCheck

        @Nonnull
default java.lang.Boolean usernameCheck​(@Nonnull
                                        java.lang.String username)
        Synchronously check the availability of the provided username; if the decoded response indicates the name is globally available, return `true`, otherwise `false`.
        Parameters:
        username - Username to check for global availability.
        Returns:
        Whether the provided username is available to be claimed.
        Throws:
        UsernameInvalidError - If the supplied username is blocked for policy reasons.
        UsernameIneligibleError - If the active user is not eligible to claim a username.
        See Also:
        Async version of this method.

      • usernameCheck

        @Nonnull
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> usernameCheck​(@Nonnull
                                                                                    AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.UsernameCheckRequest> rpc)
        Asynchronously check the availability of the provided username; if the decoded response indicates the name is globally available, return `true`, otherwise `false`.
        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC describing the username to check for uniqueness.
        Returns:
        Listenable future which resolve to a boolean which indicates whether the provided username is available to be claimed.
        Throws:
        UsernameInvalidError - If the supplied username is blocked for policy reasons.
        UsernameIneligibleError - If the active user is not eligible to claim a username.
        See Also:
        Synchronous version of this method.

      • fetch

        @Nonnull
default java.util.Optional<cookies.schema.store.ProfileResponse> fetch​(@Nonnull
                                                                       SyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileRequest> rpc)
        Synchronously fetch the specified user profile, specified either via their username or their user ID; if the user could not be found, or the invoking user does not have access and the requested user's profile is set to private, return Optional.empty().

        Requesting a profile with the special username/user ID `me` requests the currently logged-in user's profile. Accessing this special path requires an active and identified user session.

        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to fetch a user profile.
        Returns:
        Optional containing the requested store user profile, or else Optional.empty() if the profile does not exist, or the invoking user does not have access to see it.
        See Also:
        Async version of this method.

      • fetch

        @Nonnull
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<java.util.Optional<cookies.schema.store.ProfileResponse>> fetch​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                                   AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileRequest> rpc)
        Asynchronously fetch the specified user profile, specified either via their username or their user ID; if the user could not be found, or the invoking user does not have access and the requested user's profile is set to private, return Optional.empty().

        Requesting a profile with the special username/user ID `me` requests the currently logged-in user's profile. Accessing this special path requires an active and identified user session.

        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to fetch a user profile.
        Returns:
        Future which resolves to an Optional containing the requested store user profile, or else Optional.empty() if the profile does not exist, or the invoking user does not have access to see it.
        See Also:
        Synchronous version of this method.

      • update

        @Nonnull
default cookies.schema.store.model.StoreUser update​(@Nonnull
                                                    SyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileUpdateRequest> rpc)
        Synchronously apply the specified update to a user's profile, and then return the updated profile with any requested changes applied; if changes fail to apply because of concurrent mutations (or any other reason), this method will throw an exception.

        Requests to update user profiles must, of course, be affixed with user authorization which matches the profile under edit.

        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to edit the current user's profile.
        Returns:
        The updated user profile, with any requested changes applied.
        See Also:
        Async version of this method.

      • update

        @Nonnull
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.StoreUser> update​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileUpdateRequest> rpc)
        Asynchronously apply the specified update to a user's profile, and then return the updated profile with any requested changes applied; if changes fail to apply because of concurrent mutations (or any other reason), this method will throw an exception.

        Requests to update user profiles must, of course, be affixed with user authorization which matches the profile under edit.

        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to edit the current user's profile.
        Returns:
        Future which resolves to the updated user profile, with any requested changes applied.
        See Also:
        Synchronous version of this method.
